page.title: 17THE MIDLAND BUS MUSEUM
page.content: This Museum by the church is run by interested volunteers.We set out from the Museum in Wythall on an old open double-decker bus. We sat upstairs until it started to rain.The bus went up Station Rd., along Alcester Rd., the Expressway and back round to Wythall Church.Entrance fee was 75p. adults and 40p. children.Some very old buses had been rescued from scrap and one old bus had been a caravan.Some of the makes were Guys,Daimlers and Leyland.One bus which my Dad could remember from the West Country was used around Lyme Regis and even round Sidmouth.One old open double-decker was about{60 years}old.All these old buses have been restored in the workshops at the Museum. It is open on the fourth Sunday.The conductor takes your money like long ago.{Meadow Green { }
